text: Henryk Bromowicz (22 February 1924 – 30 December 1982), was a Polish ice hockey player. He played for HKS Siemianowiczanka, RKS Sile Giszowiec, and Legia Warsaw during his career. He also played for the Polish national team at the 1948, 1952, and 1956 Winter Olympics, and three world championships, in 1947, 1955, and 1957.
